Content:
I tried to start my '96 Goldwing today at about 2Celcius. I gave it full choke and tried to start it about 8 times until the battery was almost dead. I don't think I let the starter turn over any longer than 8 seconds at the longest and most of the tries were under 5 seconds. I thought the battery should have lasted longer than that. I have had the battery maintainer on it since I stopped riding in October.

Do you think the battery is weak?
Should the maintainer have kept the battery at 80% or more?
How much did the cold weather affect the starting?
Can I charge the battery with the charger in the picture below?

Thanks for any help and/or suggestions.
